binaryOption.name: usb_clk_recovery_irc_en_en
binaryOption.toolTip: Must be selected to enable USB clock recovery

binaryOption.name: clk_recovery_ctrl_reset_resume_rough_en
binaryOption.toolTip:
The clock recovery block tracks the IRC48Mhz to get an accurate 48Mhz clock.
 It has two phases after user enables clock_recover_en bit, rough phase and tracking phase.
 The step to fine tune the IRC 48Mhz by adjusting the trim fine value is different during these two phases.
 The step in rough phase is larger than that in tracking phase. 
 Switch back to rough stage whenever USB bus reset or bus resume occurs.

choice.name: Always works in tracking phase after the 1st time rough to track transition
Go back to rough stage whenever bus reset or bus resume occurs

binaryOption.name: clk_recovery_ctrl_restart_ifttrim_en
binaryOption.toolTip: IRC48 has a default trim fine value whose default value is factory trimmed (the IFR trim value).\n Clock recover block tracks the accuracy of the clock 48Mhz and keeps updating the trim fine value accordingly
